name: Preethi Mahakala
title: Senior Full Stack Java Developer
professional_summary: Focused on building scalable web applications across Banking, Healthcare, and Retail sectors using modern frontend frameworks like NextJs and ReactJs, paired with robust Java Spring Boot backends.
Configured TypeScript with Object Oriented JavaScript patterns to ensure type safety and maintainable code structure across large-scale enterprise applications.
Operationalized Material UI components to accelerate the delivery of consistent, accessible user interfaces that adhere to strict industry design standards.
Collaborated with architecture teams to define RESTful API contracts, enabling seamless data flow between NextJs frontends and NodeJS microservices.
Facilitated the integration of SQL databases within containerized Docker environments to support persistent data layers for customer-facing applications.
Partnered with DevOps engineers to establish Git-based CI/CD pipelines using Kubernetes, which automated deployments and reduced manual release efforts.
Assembled comprehensive unit test suites with Jest and React Testing Library to validate component logic and improve code reliability before production merges.
Assisted in performance tuning exercises using Webpack to minimize bundle sizes and enhance the loading speed of ReactJs single-page applications.
Coordinated daily Agile ceremonies, utilizing JIRA to track user stories and ensure timely delivery of features aligned with business priorities.
Guided junior team members through complex debugging sessions on Linux servers, fostering knowledge sharing and strengthening team problem-solving capacity.

responsibilities: Architected a new client portal using NextJs and TypeScript, which replaced a legacy system and improved page load times for high-net-worth banking customers.
Constructed a suite of reusable Material UI components, established a shared design library that accelerated frontend development for three separate internal teams.
Migrated a critical fund calculation module from a monolithic Java application to a Spring Boot microservice, enhancing its scalability and testability.
Established a Docker-based local development environment that mirrored the AWS production stack, reducing onboarding time for new developers from one week to two days.
Integrated Jest and React Testing Library into the CI/CD pipeline, which automatically ran unit tests on every Git commit and blocked merges with insufficient coverage.
Deployed the primary customer dashboard application to a Kubernetes cluster on AWS, configured Helm charts for consistent deployment across staging and production.
Monitored application performance with AWS CloudWatch, identified a memory leak in a NodeJS service, and patched it during the next scheduled maintenance window.
Reviewed SQL query patterns for the new portfolio feature, suggested index additions that decreased average response time from 450ms to under 100ms.
Participated in daily stand-ups and bi-weekly sprint planning sessions, used JIRA to break down complex regulatory requirements into actionable development tasks.
Mentored two junior developers on ReactJs best practices and code review etiquette, which improved the overall quality of pull requests submitted by the team.
Troubleshot a production issue where CSS styles broke on older browsers, implemented a polyfill solution via Webpack that restored consistent UI rendering.
Documented the API integration process between the NextJs frontend and Spring Boot backend, created Confluence pages that became the team's standard reference.
Developed patient management dashboard features with ReactJs and Context API, ensuring the UI complied with HIPAA regulations for data display and security.
Engineered RESTful APIs with Java Spring Boot to handle sensitive healthcare data, implemented robust input validation and audit logging for all data access.
Built automated CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins that deployed Docker containers to a Kubernetes cluster, enabling reliable zero-downtime updates for critical systems.
Tested new enrollment flow components extensively with React Testing Library, which caught several edge-case bugs before the feature reached members.
Assembled a reporting module that queraled complex SQL joins to generate patient eligibility reports, optimized queries to run within strict SLA windows.
Configured GitLab merge requests to require two approvals and successful pipeline execution, which became a team standard and reduced regression bugs.
Updated the build configuration in Webpack to split vendor and application code, which decreased the initial load time of the main application by a significant margin.
Worked closely with QA analysts to reproduce and fix bugs logged in JIRA, often pair-programming to understand the exact user scenario that caused the issue.
Applied Object Oriented JavaScript principles to refactor a large, tangled React component into smaller, composable functions that were easier to test and maintain.
Produced technical documentation for the claims processing integration, diagrammed the data flow to assist the support team during off-hours escalations.
Created product search and filtering components for the e-commerce website using ReactJs and plain CSS, which handled high traffic during holiday sales events.
Implemented backend services with Java to manage inventory data, wrote SQL stored procedures to update stock levels in real-time based on online purchases.
Deployed application updates using a manual process to on-premise Linux servers, followed a detailed runbook to ensure consistency across all environments.
Monitored application logs for errors after each release, often stayed late to fix any urgent issues that arose from the deployment before the store opening.
Used Git for version control, participated in code reviews to learn best practices and suggest small improvements to colleagues' implementations.
Supported the migration of static HTML pages to a more dynamic React-based structure, which laid the groundwork for future personalization features.
